info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 5:35PM PDT by NWS Missoula MT
info.description:
At 533 PM PDT, Doppler radar and satellite were tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles east of Paradise to 14 miles southwest of White Bird. Movement was northeast at 25 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, loacalized heavy rainfall, and frequent lightning.
SOURCE...Radar and satellite indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding on roadways and minor localized flooding possible.
Locations impacted include... Grangeville, White Bird, Cottonwood, Ferdinand, Canfield, Winona, Keuterville, Slate Creek, Harpster, Copperville, and Fenn.
info.instruction:
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
